thread.title: Tottenham Hotspur unveil swanky hospitality options for new stadium… but it’s all very corporate with just one fan wearing football top
thread.title_full: Tottenham Hotspur unveil swanky hospitality options for new stadium… but it’s all very corporate with just one fan wearing football top

author: fnathan
title: Tottenham Hotspur unveil swanky hospitality options for new stadium… but it’s all very corporate with just one fan wearing football top
text:
Comments TOTTENHAM have unveiled swanky hospitality options for their new stadium… but it’s all very corporate. 
Photos revealed by the Premier League club show an array of top-of-the-range corporate areas, some of which will set you back £15,000 for the season. Tottenham Hotspur This premium concourse will provide space for networking while providing lots of chicken Tottenham Hotspur 14 The Tunnel Club allows fans to see their players head back to the dressing room through the glass 
Keep up to date with ALL the Tottenham Hotspur news, gossip, transfers and goals on our club page plus fixtures, results and live match commentary 
But in the virtual-reality images, despite the incredible-looking facilities, it feels very corporate like an airport lounge – not helped by only one of the CGI-generated fans wearing a Spurs top. 
Spurs claim the ground, costing £750million and open in 2018 will be the world’s “most technologically advanced stadium”– and bookings are already being taken for a choice of suites, lounges, clubs and seats. Tottenham Hotspur On the ninth floor of the ground, the Sky Lounge will give an airy space Tottenham Hotspur Fans can also get a panoramic view of the pitch from the Sky Lounge Getty Images 14 The new ground is springing up fast and will be open next year 
It will become London’s largest capacity football club ground with 61,000 seats, and will feature a retractable grass field for Tottenham home fixtures with an artificial surface underneath capable of hosting NFL matches and concerts. 
Premium seats start at £89 per person per match, rising to £214 – and has access to concourses with giant screens showing the match and food options (rotisserie chickens seemingly popular). Tottenham Hotspur One of the premium spaces, Super Loges, will offer private dining and networking spaces Tottenham Hotspur 14 In the CGI-generated images, this one contains the only person wearing a Spurs top! 
The cheapest lounge is the Sky Lounge, costing £195 per person, and is right at the top of the stadium offering a panoramic view of the pitch. related stories Neil Ashton Since Sergio Aguero arrived in England Manchester City have spent £569m on 42 players - only ONE has been a success seven help us Antoine Griezmann? Anthony Martial? Marcus Rashford? — who should be Manchester United's next No.7? payet hammered Dimitri Payet deleted from West Ham Whatsapp group... as his car is vandalised outside home POCH'S LAM STEW Erik Lamela faces scan as Mauricio Pochettino admits the Argentinian's injuries 'concern' Spurs VANTASY LAND! Marco van Basten's radical plans upset Premier League as he wants to axe offside and have sin bins MORE POWER Jake Livermore close to £10m switch from Hull as West Brom eye first transfer window deal BRAZIL-LIANT Man United stars Ibrahimovic and Mkhitaryan enjoy dinner date at Brazilian barbecue... but did they eat the chicken hearts? Lamela injury woe Mauricio Pochettino concerned with Erik Lamela recovery with the winger set for a scan on hip injury Chelsea smile Diego Costa beams in cheesy team photo as he puts furious training bust-up behind him DON'T GET CARRIED AWAY Ronald Koeman warns Tom Davies and Ademola Lookman to keep 'feet on the ground' FOOTBALL ON TV What football is on TV today? Our guide to this week's live matches SHOOT OUT Hear Ian Wright tell SunSport why the Golden Boot will be a straight fight between Harry Kane and Zlatan 
Next up is the “Loge Suite”, which Spurs say is the first time a private dining experience in your own box will mix with a football match. Tottenham Hotspur The Tunnel Club is where paying punters can watch the players tunnel through glass Tottenham Hotspur Costing a whopping £535 per person, you can have Michelin starred food in the H Club Tottenham Hotspur unveil their swanky hospitality for the new stadium 14 SunSport's Paul Jiggins was given a virtual reality tour of the new stadium 
They are also offering private suites, from £320 which can be designed to the requirements of the occupant - and during non-event days, they can use it as an office or meeting space. 
The second most expensive option is the "Tunnel Club", which will allow fans to watch from behind the first purpose-built glass-wall in the players tunnel. Tottenham Hotspur It is a private members club with an enormously big cost attached Tottenham Hotspur 14 It also offers chances to entertain while in corporate hospitality 
Paying punters shelling out £339 each, or £9,500 a season, will get behind-the-scenes views of the players tunnel before, during and after the game, and will be able to watch the match from just behind the dugouts. 
Tottenham insist their stars love the idea of fans being able to watch them in the tunnel, but when asked about it yesterday their manager Mauricio Pochettino afforded himself a wry smile as he admitted: “It’s dangerous, very dangerous because there have been a lot of things that have happened in the tunnel. 
“It is for that reason, the price of sitting there will be very expensive!” 
Finally, the crème de la crème is the "H Club", a members club which will offer Michelin starred food at the chef's table or with a Spurs legend - but it is an eye-watering £535 per person - or £15,000 a season. Tottenham Hotspur You will be able to dine at the chef's table or with a Spurs legend - probably not Roberto Soldado Tottenham Hotspur 14 Built on the site of the old White Hart Lane, the stadium will be the biggest club ground in London 
Tickets for both the Tunnel Club and The H Club must be bought in pairs – and before you are eligible to buy those you must first stump up £30,000 for a couple of memberships. 
Access to White Hart Lane’s Oak Room, the most expensive seats at the club at present, costs supporters’ £10,000 a season - and Spurs’ faithful will have to pay more at the new ground . 
Regardless of the corporate nature, it is still sure to send Spurs, currently playing in the modestly-sized White Hart Lane which will disappear as the new ground is build on top of it, into the category one of the world's biggest clubs.
